    Rendering depicting the MoMA Design Store, Soho renovation provided by Peterson Rich Office © 2025

    Brooklyn-based Peterson Rich Office (PRO) is engaged in a renovation of the MoMA Design Store’s popular SoHo location on Spring Street in New York City. MoMA announced the project earlier this week, along with the scope of the work, which will help it "better reflect how visitors engage with retail and design today." The store will reopen later this fall. The practice was also included in the museum’s recent highly publicized New York, New Publics exhibition. 

    PRO is currently at work redesigning public spaces at The Met after completing two cultural projects—a glass-enclosed expansion of the Davison Arts Center at Wesleyan University and an adaptive reuse for a new art gallery space in Detroit—last year.
